raw_mentions:
Here are the extracted sentences/rows that meet the criteria:

1. The results obtained indicated that TGF-/82 inhibited incorporation of <sup>3</sup>H-thymidine into the DNA of murine thymocytes with an ED<sub>50</sub> of approximately 4 pM.
2. The TGF-/32<sub>16</sub>_<sub>47</sub> dimer was also active as an inhibitor of thymocyte proliferation in this assay with an ED<sub>50</sub> of 57 nM.
3. However, both TGF-3l<sub>16</sub>_<sub>31</sub> dimer and <sup>T</sup>GF-S2<sub>1</sub>g_<sub>31</sub> dimer did not affect <sup>3</sup>H-thymidine incorporation at concentrations up to 0.8 μM.
4. TGF-01 TGF-01 10-30 pM
5. TGF-02 TGF-02 100-130 pM
6. TGF-01<sub>16</sub>. -31 dimer TGF-01, TGF- <sup>■</sup>02 10-15 μM
7. TGF-02<sub>16</sub>. <sup>■</sup>31 dimer TGF-02 30 μM
8. TGF-02<sub>16</sub>. -47 dimer TGF-02 3 μM
9. The apparent dissociation constants were estimated to be 10-30 pM for TGF-01 and 100-130 pM for TGF-02.
10. TGF-02<sub>16</sub>_<sub>47</sub> dimer competed against the binding of <sup>125</sup>I-TGF-02 with an apparent dissociation constant of approximately 3 μM.
11. TGF-01<sub>16</sub>_<sub>31</sub> peptide monomers, and TGF-01<sub>1</sub>g_<sub>47</sub> peptide monomers and dimers at concentrations of up to 30 μM were found to be either inactive or weakly active in competing against the binding of <sup>125</sup>I-TGF-01 or <sup>125</sup>I-TGF-02.
12. TGF-02 60 pM
13. TGF-02<sub>32</sub>.<sub>47</sub> peptide as monomer and as dimer at concentrations up to 30 μM did not compete against the binding of <sup>125</sup>I-TGF-02 to the L6 rat muscle myoblasts.
